skills.name: Calculate the volume of a cylinder when the dimensions are given in the same units
Calculate the volume of a cone where the dimensions are all given in the same units

explanations.A: This formula tells us to multiply πr² by the height of the cylinder. This will give us the volume of the cylinder. Which formula is not equivalent to this?
explanations.B: This formula tells us to multiply πr² by the height of the cylinder. This will give us the volume of the cylinder. Which formula is not equivalent to this?
explanations.C: To find the volume of a cylinder we need to multiply the base area by the height. We do not then need to multiply it by the radius. We will use the radius when calculating the base area (πr²)
explanations.D: This formula tells us to multiply the base area by the height of the cylinder. This will give us the volume of the cylinder. Which formula is not equivalent to this?
